page.title: 15LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS
page.content: On the thirty first of May 1985, Primaries five six and seven went on a country walk to Craigfoodie House. At Craigfoodie House the gardener told us that part of the house was built in the seventeenth century. At the back of the house there is a dove cot where the owners once kept pigeons to eat. We went further up the hill to some cottages and an old farm steading. There was a pen where some goats were. On the way back we stopped to look at oil seed rape,young barley and potatoes growing in the fields. We also saw sheep and cows grazing and a farmer from a tractor getting water from Moonzie Burn. Miss Smith stopped to talk to the farmer. By Owain May and Emma Strickland.
